column2: The wiser races are capable of sculpting gold into magnificent idols.
Beer is incredibly important to Dwarfs and men alike, although the watery brews of the umgi are rightly shunned by thirsty Dawi.
Fauna and game are worth hunting for both food and furs. Of course, in the Old World's forests, a hunter must be wary of becoming the hunted.
This location is of special importance to the Skaven and Lizardmen.
Elven baubles lack the practicality of Dwarf-made items, but the finesse within makes then undeniably exquisite.
This location is of special importance to the Empire provinces and Bretonnian kingdoms.
It takes an artisan to carve and fashion obsidian. Dark Elves are the true masters of this art, although others have produced fine pieces too.
This location is of special importance to the Dwarfs realms and the Skaven.
This location is of special importance to the Vampire Counts and the Followers of Nagash.
Wood is a flexible resource, used in anything from buildings to hand weapons. Just be careful which trees you take it from, as some won't take kindly to being felled.
Herbs and flora with medicinal properties are always valued by apothecaries.
This location is of special importance to the Dwarf realms and the Greenskin Tribes.
This location is of special importance to the Empire and the Vampire Counts.
This location is of special importance to the High Elves and Dark Elves.
This location is of special importance to the High Elves and the Wood Elves.
Salt can be taken from the sea or the mines. It is a useful commodity and not just a way for Halfling cooks to season meat.
While a High Elf would turn his nose up at it, Bretonnian wine is said to be the best - although the southern wineries of the Empire are now challenging its prominence.
Iron ore can be fashioned into many things, but in these lands it is mainly used for weapons. Of course, some races are better at metallurgy than others.
This location has a large garrison, but cannot have economic buildings.
This location is of special importance.
Marble is a valuable and exotic material mainly used in grandstanding buildings, having great value within the nations of man.
This location is of special importance to the Dwarf realms.
This location is of special importance to the Bretonnian Dukedoms.
This location is of special importance to the Bretonnian kingdoms, High Elves and Wood Elves.
This location is of special importance to the Empire, Bretonnia, and the Vampire Counts.
This location is of special importance to the Greenskin Tribes.
This location contains many components deemed essential for rituals.
From clay comes ceramics that range from basic bowls to more delicate and extravagant items.
This location is of special importance to the Elves, Empire provinces and Bretonnian kingdoms.
This location is of special importance to the Lizardmen.
This location is of special importance to the Southern Realms.
This location is of special importance to the Dark Elves.
This location is of special importance to the High Elves.
This location is the site of an ancient High Elf colony. It increases income from ports.
Gems hold great value for they are precious and prized, with only the occasional Daemon imprisoned within.
The presence of gold is a sign that a mine can be placed and the wealth it brings harvested.
This area is sacred to the Savage Orcs; at some point the Greenskins' tribal migration will bring them to this area.
This location is of special importance to the Norscans.
This location is of special importance to the Dwarf realms, the Greenskin Tribes and the Skaven.
The spices and seasonings sourced in far Cathay and Ind hold great value due to their rarity.
This location is of special importance to the Empire provinces.
This location is of special importance to the Vampire Counts.
This location is of special importance to the Tomb Kings.
Pastures are rare places of peace for animals to graze, where farmers can tend to their herds and flocks.
This location is of special importance to the Skaven.
This location is of special importance to the Dwarf Realms, Greenskin Tribes, Skaven, Vampire Counts and the Followers of Nagash.
The creation of dyes to feed the burgeoning fashions of the courts of the Old World is a vibrant industry indeed.
The hides and furs of creatures from across the Great Ocean fetch a hefty price.
The hardened sap of the greenwood is sought after by Wood Elves, but all races know its value.
